SENT.plain: A dual-chamber pacemaker was implanted because of symptomatic bradycardia in a 60-year-old patient free from other heart disease
Then, the patient developed acute congestive heart failure due to pacing-induced mitral regurgitation (MR)
Under echocardiographic guidance, modification of location of the right ventricular pacing lead led to a significant decrease in MR severity resulting in immediate clinical improvement
